title: Star Trek Discovery’s Sonequa Martin-Green teases what’s to come in season 3
text:
Sonequa Martin-Green has got us all hyped up ahead of Discovery season three (Picture: CBS)

Star Trek: Discovery star Sonequa Martin-Green teased out a few details about what to expect in Season three in an interview with Trek Movie, and trekkers there has been plenty of singing and dancing.

On how her character Michael Burnham has changed this season the actor was a little coy about going into too much detail but is ‘very excited’.

‘I wish I could tell you,’ she said. ‘I’m very excited to share it, because there has been deep deep deep change. As we see in the trailer that we just released, there’s been a year, and there’s been an inevitable maturation in that year.

The 34-year-old actor said the change is very ‘linked to the future we’re in’, which will present ‘an entirely brand-new tapestry of conflict.’

She was also full of praise for the way the show writers have embraced change as ‘a sort of cornerstone’ for her role as Michael and ramped up ‘that question of identity … to the nth degree’.

Like us, Sonequa will be missing Pike too this season (Picture: CBS)

On the question of who we’d be seeing Michael interacting with on the new season, Sonequa said she will miss Pike, Tyler and Lorca who we lose in this jump to the future but ‘this cast is stellar’.

‘That was one of the things I was most excited about when I found out we were going to be jumping to the future,’ she said. ‘As much as we will forever miss the people that have come before, and we will never forget them, and did not want them to leave. the fact is that we have to find who we are together in this new future that can’t help but bind us together.

‘And so that in itself creates a lot of opportunity for us to play off of each other and with each other as we discover the new world.’

She revealed that we should be getting a bunch Burnham and Saru scenes and Tilly and Stamets will also spend a lot of time together. Plus David Ajala, who is brand new to the cast is getting a lot of love. But she said ‘you will be seeing a lot of people interacting with each other that you haven’t seen much of before.’

Sonequa said she has a list of favourite Michael scenes but they are a heady mix of conversation and action, ‘so it’s hard to pinpoint’.

But she did say that moments when the cast all comes together such as ‘bridge days’ are probably her favourite type of scene if she had to narrow it down.

Sonequa said that while the singing and dancing ‘never stops’ as to whether there will be any big songs this season she could only respond: ‘we’ll see’.

For now trekkers will have to settle for rewatching the season three trailer, while they wait for Picard to be released in January next year.
